verses.roman:
gadā-pāṇī ubhau dṛṣṭvā
saṁrabdhau vijayaiṣiṇau
maṇḍalāni vicitrāṇi
carantāv idam abravīt

synonyms: gadā—with clubs; pāṇī—in their hands; ubhau—both of them, Duryodhana and Bhīma; dṛṣṭvā—seeing; saṁrabdhau—furious; vijaya—victory; eṣiṇau—striving for; maṇḍalāni—circles; vicitrāṇi—artistic; carantau—moving in; idam—this; abravīt—He said.
translation: Lord Balarāma found Duryodhana and Bhīma with clubs in their hands, each furiously striving for victory over the other as they circled about skillfully. The Lord addressed them as follows.
